Cappuccino originated in Italy. The traditional cappuccino is prepared with two or one shots of rich espresso, topped with foamed milk. Cappuccino provides various psychological health benefits such as mind stimulation and mental alertness.
1/6 espresso; 4/6 steamed milk; 1/6 foamed milk \n75 mg caffeine per 12 oz.

Latte originated in Italy. It is prepared with a rich shot of espresso, layered with steamed milk, and topped with a thin layer of foam. Lattes are very diluted and have a sweet, mellow flavor that can light up your day.

A mocha consists of espresso and hot milk with added chocolate, typically in the form of sweet cocoa powder or chocolate syrup. Mocha is relatively low in caffeine and tastes more like hot chocolate, which makes it a great coffee choice for both morning and afternoon.
2/5 espresso; 2/5 chocolate syrup; 1/5 steamed milk \n95 mg caffeine per 12 oz.
2/5 espresso; 3/5 hot water \n150 mg caffeine per 12 oz.

Cafe Americano is a watered-down shot of espresso with a flavor arriving very close to simple, brewed coffee. The strong espresso in Americano awakens and increases productivity, but consumption is not suggested after 7pm.
3/4 espresso; 1/4 steamed milk \n169 mg caffeine per 12 oz.

A macchiato is simply a shot of espresso topped with foamed milk. Macchiato can help gain focusness and mental alertness and also keep your blood pressure in control. However, high intake may cause side effects, such as increases in anxiety and nervousness.

"Espresso is coffee brewed by forcing out a small amount of nearly boiling water under pressure through finely ground coffee beans. It is always a good idea to stop ordering espresso 8 hours before you go to bed. "
